Wayland murder case

Fujita sentenced to life

Wayland man gets life without parole

Nathaniel Fujita was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole today after he was found guilty of first-degree murder in the 2011 slaying of Lauren Astley, his former high school girlfriend. (1:40 p.m.)

Snow and rain through Friday

Today's storm is causing strong winds and high seas, and will continue to influence our area through Friday morning, meteorologist Dave Epstein writes. (12:15 p.m.)

As cardinals gather at the Vatican, still no date set to choose a new pope

Imprisoned DiMasi weak with cancer, wife says

In federal prison for corruption, former House speaker Salvatore F. DiMasi, 68, has not been getting proper treatment for his cancer, his wife said.
Opinion | JOAN VENNOCHI

Good law, weak case for Cahill

Prosecutors didn't have enough evidence to win their case against Timothy Cahill. But corruption laws remain important tools in protecting the public interest.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Clay Buchholz must produce wins

A lot of the weight of this redemptive season rides on the slender shoulders of Buch­holz.

Risk, opportunity in Chavez death

Chavez's death is a chance for the US to make our relationships with Latin America less about leaders and more about common interests.

A too-faint 'Distant Music'

Though the characters are supposed to be at life-defining crossroads, the Stoneham Theatre production of “Distant Music’’ lacks a sense of urgency.
Opinion | EDWARD L. GLAESER

With sequester, funds up in the air

The sequester has shed a light on airport funding — and offers a view of a way to improve that financing.

Norman Rockwell inspires designer

Rockwell garbed his subjects in the utilitarian uniforms of working men and women of the mid-20th century. Now that clothing has inspired a new collection.

News

Obama signs expanded Violence Against Women Act

The law strengthens protections for victims who are attacked on tribal land. It also makes clear that lesbians, gays, and immigrants should have equal access to the law’s programs.
